titleInfo.title: Preparation and characterization of diphenylalkanes in the gas phase. Separation of isomeric products by their lifetimes

mods.abstract: The gas-phase reactions of C6H5CH2X and C6H5CH2CH2X (X = OH or halogen) with benzene in the presence of H3O+ lead to protonated diphenylalkanes. Prior to dissociation, the product ions formed by reaction with C6D6 undergo H/D exchange, which has been nsed to characterize their structure. Thus, the reaction of C6H5CH2CH2X yields selectively protonated 1,2-diphenylethane. This apparent selectivity is a consequence of the very short lifetime of the isomeric protonated 1,1-diphenylethane generated by reaction ofthe C6H5CHCH3+ ion by an SN1 mechanism.
